title: GOROOT_FINAL gets ignored by runtime.a
body:
What steps will reproduce the problem?
1. compile with GOROOT_FINAL=/usr/lib/golang and GOROOT=/tmp/build/golang-<version>
2. run godoc

What is the expected output?
$ godoc 
usage: godoc package [name ...]
[...]
  -goroot="/usr/lib/golang": Go root directory


What do you see instead?
$ godoc 
usage: godoc package [name ...]
[...]
  -goroot="/tmp/buildd/golang-2011.02.01.1": Go root directory

Which compiler are you using (5g, 6g, 8g, gccgo)?
n/a

Which operating system are you using?
Linux

Which revision are you using?  (hg identify)
release.2011-02-01.1

Please provide any additional information below.

It's needed for Debian packages (targeted at unstable).  Patch will follow...
